item.title: Katy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There was never yet an uninteresting life. Such a thing is an impossibility. Inside of the dullest exterior there is a drama, a comedy, and a tragedy." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Katy add a quote by Terry Brooks
item.description: "Who would you be but who you are?" -- Terry Brooks

item.title: Katy add a quote by Beatrix Potter
item.description: "Thank goodness I was never sent to school; it would have rubbed off some of the originality." -- Beatrix Potter

item.title: Katy add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Katy add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Katy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katy add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Katy add a quote by Emily Bronte
item.description: "Oh, Cathy! Oh, my life! how can I bear it?" was the first sentence he uttered, in a tone that did not seek to disguise his despair. And now he stared at her so earnestly that I thought the very intensity of his gaze would bring tears into his eyes; but they burned with anguish: they did not melt." -- Emily Bronte

item.title: Katy add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Katy add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Oh well... I'd just been thinking, if you had died, you'd have been welcome to share my toilet." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Katy add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Let us step into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Katy add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Live in the present, remember the past, and fear not the future, for it doesn't exist and never shall. There is only now." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Katy add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Books are my friends, my companions. They make me laugh and cry and find meaning in life." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Katy add a quote by Christopher Moore
Katy add a quote by Terry Brooks
item.description: "Why pretend to be something you're not? If you have to be someone, be someone no one else is." -- Terry Brooks

item.title: Katy add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "If you have come to these pages for laughter, may you find it. If you are here to be offended, may your ire rise and your blood boil. If you seek an adventure, may this song sing you away to blissful escape. If you need to test or confirm your beliefs, may you reach comfortable conclusions. All books reveal perfection, by what they are or what they are not. May you find that which you seek, in these pages or outside them. May you find perfection, and know it by name." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Katy add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Oh, I get it," I said. "It's a parable. Cute. Let's go eat." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Katy add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "The music coming from inside sounded like robots fucking. And complaining about it. In rhythmic monotone. European robots." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Katy add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "The Emperor decided to make a proclamation to his troops about the importance of compassion in the face of the rising tide of heinous fuckery and political weaselocity in the nearby kingdom of the United States." -- Christopher Moore
